commits.message: Rename endowment and add a test

issue.title: Review which permissions could be combined in the install modal
issue.body:
Example: endowment:rpc is one permission with two booleans but is displayed as two separate permissions in the install modal. This could be displayed as a single permission with clearly stated "website" and "snap" when both booleans are true. 

Output of this task is a list of recommendations for grouped permissions.

forkee.name: snaps
forkee.description: Extend the functionality of MetaMask using Snaps

issue.title: Support unencrypted storage

labels.name: area-capabilities
labels.description: Related to the kinds of things that snaps are able to do.

issue.body: Support unencrypted storage that can be accessed without MM being unlocked. This is useful for cronjobs that require state but run while the MM client may be locked.

comment.body: If we are going to break up ManageState to 3 separate methods, should we consider renaming that too?

issue.title: [help]: Updating @metamask/snaps packages from v1 to v3
issue.body:
Hi.

I'm trying to update the snaps packages (types, ui and cli) to v3.0.1, but I'm experiencing quite a lot of issues.

I want to update them to try the new `snap_getFile` method.

Issues:
- Broken import of `OnRpcRequestHandler` (tsc doesn't recognize the type import and handles it as any). We are using Typescript v5, but I also tested with 4.8.4 and it also didn't work.
- snap and ethereum global objects are not recognized (show up as any). I think this is related to the above issue
- We are getting an `[SyntaxError: Possible HTML comment rejected at <unknown>:36345. (SES_HTML_COMMENT_REJECTED)` error. Looking into it, I found out it is coming from this code in the bundle `const endIndex = findClosingIndex(xmlData, "-->", i3 + 4, "Comment is not closed.");`. This code is part of the `parseXml` function inside `fast-xml-parser` used inside the `is-svg` library, which is used in couple of snaps libraries.

For building, we are using ESBuild.

I also tested it with `mm-snap` build, but I am getting a `JavaScript heap out of memory` error. This error and slow build times, is also the reason we are using ESBuild. I also don't think it is causing the above mentioned issues.

Testable example can be found [here](https://github.com/blockchain-lab-um/masca/tree/feat/update-snap-packages/packages/snap)

I appreciate your help.

comment.body:
I fixed the types issues by adding `"types": "./dist/types/index.d.ts"` here: https://github.com/MetaMask/snaps/blob/3c968a2d1a5d2e0b9f22ad753dcf4109de3b7832/packages/snaps-utils/package.json#L16

Now it loks like this:
![image](https://github.com/MetaMask/snaps/assets/35891136/116711f8-c941-41a8-8a4a-0336b66c83e0)

To be honest, I'm not sure why it works now, and it didn't before. Tried understanding it using [this](https://gist.github.com/andrewbranch/79f872a8b9f0507c9c5f2641cfb3efa6#packagejson-exports), but still lost :rofl: .

issue.title: [help]: Updating @metamask/snaps packages from v1 to v3
issue.body:
Hi.

I'm trying to update the snaps packages (types, ui and cli) to v3.0.1, but I'm experiencing quite a lot of issues.

I want to update them to try the new `snap_getFile` method.

Issues:
- Broken import of `OnRpcRequestHandler` (tsc doesn't recognize the type import and handles it as any). We are using Typescript v5, but I also tested with 4.8.4 and it also didn't work.
- snap and ethereum global objects are not recognized (show up as any). I think this is related to the above issue
- We are getting an `[SyntaxError: Possible HTML comment rejected at <unknown>:36345. (SES_HTML_COMMENT_REJECTED)` error. Looking into it, I found out it is coming from this code in the bundle `const endIndex = findClosingIndex(xmlData, "-->", i3 + 4, "Comment is not closed.");`. This code is part of the `parseXml` function inside `fast-xml-parser` used inside the `is-svg` library, which is used in couple of snaps libraries.

For building, we are using ESBuild.

I also tested it with `mm-snap` build, but I am getting a `JavaScript heap out of memory` error. This error and slow build times, is also the reason we are using ESBuild. I also don't think it is causing the above mentioned issues.

Testable example can be found [here](https://github.com/blockchain-lab-um/masca/tree/feat/update-snap-packages/packages/snap)

I appreciate your help.

comment.body:
@FrederikBolding 

Another update regarding the types issue. 
I tried to import the `OnRpcRequestHandler` from `snaps-utils` now instead of `snaps-types` and I get this error now:

![image](https://github.com/MetaMask/snaps/assets/35891136/4b0cf487-04af-4f11-be04-b63909eff462)

Do you maybe have an idea ?

issue.title: Consider maintaining an ESBuild plugin for building snaps

comment.body:
From refinement:
* Masca team uses ESBuild.
* The costs for supporting this are creating the plugin and additional work around maintenance.

issue.title: Investigate pausing timer while the snap is waiting for the network

comment.body:
From refinement:
* The problem here is that when we pause the timer, it pauses for all requests.
* Frederik to revive PR (only applies to fetch).
From refinement: To begin implementation as we are close enough in terms of design

issue.title: [help]: Updating @metamask/snaps packages from v1 to v3
issue.body:
Hi.

I'm trying to update the snaps packages (types, ui and cli) to v3.0.1, but I'm experiencing quite a lot of issues.

I want to update them to try the new `snap_getFile` method.

Issues:
- Broken import of `OnRpcRequestHandler` (tsc doesn't recognize the type import and handles it as any). We are using Typescript v5, but I also tested with 4.8.4 and it also didn't work.
- snap and ethereum global objects are not recognized (show up as any). I think this is related to the above issue
- We are getting an `[SyntaxError: Possible HTML comment rejected at <unknown>:36345. (SES_HTML_COMMENT_REJECTED)` error. Looking into it, I found out it is coming from this code in the bundle `const endIndex = findClosingIndex(xmlData, "-->", i3 + 4, "Comment is not closed.");`. This code is part of the `parseXml` function inside `fast-xml-parser` used inside the `is-svg` library, which is used in couple of snaps libraries.

For building, we are using ESBuild.

I also tested it with `mm-snap` build, but I am getting a `JavaScript heap out of memory` error. This error and slow build times, is also the reason we are using ESBuild. I also don't think it is causing the above mentioned issues.

Testable example can be found [here](https://github.com/blockchain-lab-um/masca/tree/feat/update-snap-packages/packages/snap)

I appreciate your help.

comment.body:
Quick update regarding the problem number 3.

It was easily resolved by adding the code you linked to our `post-process.js` file, which we already used to do some post-processing on the output bundle.

Just for reference, I added it like this:

![image](https://github.com/MetaMask/snaps/assets/35891136/bfa758cd-feb0-4ddb-b1cd-73a706948e49)

pull_request.title: Fix issues with popup disappearing
pull_request.body: Use `ApprovalController:startFlow` to fix issues with the client popup disappearing during install. This effectively keeps the popup open if it already is and otherwise waits to open the popup until we trigger our first approval.

issue.title: [help]: Updating @metamask/snaps packages from v1 to v3
issue.body:
Hi.

I'm trying to update the snaps packages (types, ui and cli) to v3.0.1, but I'm experiencing quite a lot of issues.

I want to update them to try the new `snap_getFile` method.

Issues:
- Broken import of `OnRpcRequestHandler` (tsc doesn't recognize the type import and handles it as any). We are using Typescript v5, but I also tested with 4.8.4 and it also didn't work.
- snap and ethereum global objects are not recognized (show up as any). I think this is related to the above issue
- We are getting an `[SyntaxError: Possible HTML comment rejected at <unknown>:36345. (SES_HTML_COMMENT_REJECTED)` error. Looking into it, I found out it is coming from this code in the bundle `const endIndex = findClosingIndex(xmlData, "-->", i3 + 4, "Comment is not closed.");`. This code is part of the `parseXml` function inside `fast-xml-parser` used inside the `is-svg` library, which is used in couple of snaps libraries.

For building, we are using ESBuild.

I also tested it with `mm-snap` build, but I am getting a `JavaScript heap out of memory` error. This error and slow build times, is also the reason we are using ESBuild. I also don't think it is causing the above mentioned issues.

Testable example can be found [here](https://github.com/blockchain-lab-um/masca/tree/feat/update-snap-packages/packages/snap)

I appreciate your help.

comment.body:
Thanks for the help.

I will look at the code you provided and try to resolve the html comment issue.

Regarding the type issues, I am also a little bit lost. The imports work, but the OnRpcRequestHandler shows as `any`.

Thanks for the help.

If I find out anything that could help others, I will post it here.

issue.title: Consider maintaining an ESBuild plugin for building snaps
[help]: Updating @metamask/snaps packages from v1 to v3
issue.body:
Hi.

I'm trying to update the snaps packages (types, ui and cli) to v3.0.1, but I'm experiencing quite a lot of issues.

I want to update them to try the new `snap_getFile` method.

Issues:
- Broken import of `OnRpcRequestHandler` (tsc doesn't recognize the type import and handles it as any). We are using Typescript v5, but I also tested with 4.8.4 and it also didn't work.
- snap and ethereum global objects are not recognized (show up as any). I think this is related to the above issue
- We are getting an `[SyntaxError: Possible HTML comment rejected at <unknown>:36345. (SES_HTML_COMMENT_REJECTED)` error. Looking into it, I found out it is coming from this code in the bundle `const endIndex = findClosingIndex(xmlData, "-->", i3 + 4, "Comment is not closed.");`. This code is part of the `parseXml` function inside `fast-xml-parser` used inside the `is-svg` library, which is used in couple of snaps libraries.

For building, we are using ESBuild.

I also tested it with `mm-snap` build, but I am getting a `JavaScript heap out of memory` error. This error and slow build times, is also the reason we are using ESBuild. I also don't think it is causing the above mentioned issues.

Testable example can be found [here](https://github.com/blockchain-lab-um/masca/tree/feat/update-snap-packages/packages/snap)

I appreciate your help.

comment.body:
@martines3000 Regarding the SES error, we don't currently have an ESBuild plugin for building snaps, so you may have to DIY a little bit here. The reason we have the plugins is that SES (and thereby also the Snaps platform) has certain rules that it enforces for the JS bundles, one of which is to disallow HTML comments. We have a post-processing step built-in to all of the plugins that mitigates a bunch of these problems automatically for snap developers. You can find the code [here](https://github.com/MetaMask/snaps/blob/main/packages/snaps-utils/src/post-process.ts#L213). It is exported as part of `@metamask/snaps-utils`. You could try running your bundle through that after it has been built by ESBuild, I will also make a note that we should look into maintaining a plugin ourselves.

With regards to the typing + ESM/CJS issues, I am not sure yet what could be causing this 🤔

commits.message:
Add Get File Snap to test-snaps page (#1893)

This adds the Get File Snap to the test-snaps page.
This also addresses a port overlap and switches the get-file port to
8024.

---------

Co-authored-by: Frederik Bolding <frederik.bolding@gmail.com>
Add auxiliary file to example snap package.json
Move auxiliary file to separate folder
